items.description: Book contians the storeis of Washington and the continental army through the tumultuous year of 1776. It paints a bleak picture of an overmatched rebel army that where not up to the standards. Furthermore, if not for the stoic preserverance of George washington or the courage of some of his inexperienced but promising generals the world history would be quite different.

items.title: 5 Love Languages
items.description: The book defines 5 different ways we need affection from our loved ones. It covers how you can identify which love language your significant other uses and how to strengthen love by talking to them in their language. It does this by using examples of love languages or dialects and shows how others have used them to a great extent.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/97 Things Every Programmer Should Know
items.title: 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know
items.description: This book is a collection of 97 software engineering tips and advice from experts in the field. It contains non-technical advice, technical advice and thoughts from a pretty large corpus of experience.
items.permalink: /docs/Books/Book Reviews/97 Things Every Programmer Should Know

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/A Field Guide to Lies
items.title: A Field Guide to Lies
items.description: This book is akin to calling bullshit, where it goes through all the ways people fool themselves and others. The book might make you too aware and skeptical of everything.

items.title: A little Hatred
items.description: The thrilling sequel to the first Law and its follow-up books. Set in an industrial revolution age, class struggle, money, and power are keywords. The characters are fascinating and funny in that you can see their faults even by following their perspective.

items.title: A Story of Us
items.description: It is about the evolution of us, starting from where we separated from the other apes. It is fun and engaging and tries to make stories of how premodern people are behaving.

items.title: Alchemy
items.description: This book is about the lack of knowledge and the dangers of trying to be "too" scientific.  It goes into the different aspects of human nature that is difficult to explain.

items.title: Animal Farm
items.description: The animal farm animals are free, having rebelled and expelled their human masters. Working hard under the leadership of the pigs Snowball and Napoleon, the animals toil and work harder than ever. At least all animals are equal, but some are more equal than others.

items.title: Automating Your Mac
items.description: This book is about automation in the Mac sphere. The book goes through some cool automation. Most of it is pretty unconvincing.

items.title: Best served Cold
items.description: The book is set in a different place than the first law, but a lot of the characters from the first law series are there and it is very much connected. It follows a mercenary woman and her quest for revenge. It is filled with betrayals.

items.title: Black Boy
items.description: This book depicts, from a young boy to a young man's perspective, the journey from Jim Crow South to Chicago and the trials from the communist party. It is a gripping read, where the main character is never comfortable in his environment, constantly struggling for the right to exist as an individual.  Freedom all look the same, but oppression has many faces.

items.title: Book Quotes 2022
items.description: Noise

items.title: Booklist 2023
items.description: Made to Stick

items.title: Booklist 2024
items.description: On Food and Cooking

items.title: Books
items.description: I think books are a good way to engage yourself in something completely. It is one of my favorite ways to learn and understand things, and I want to be able to read every day.

items.title: Calling Bullshit
items.description: This book is all about the BS. It is split into defining, identifying, and calling bullshit in the modern world. It is an easy read, with good examples and a skeptical eye on everything.

items.title: Designing Machine Learning Systems
items.description: This book covers the fundamentals of designing machine learning systems. It goes through the entire lifecycle of a machine learning system and then discusses the ecosystem and the challenges and cases that need to be considered.

items.title: Economics in One Lesson
items.description: This book is about prices and the fact that the economic machine should not be tampered with. It is a classic Austrian school of Economics type of book, and contains the usual arguments from that school. It uses 200 pages to conclude that you should not tamper with it.

items.title: Eisenhorn
items.description: A fantasy set in the 40k universe. The book is about the adventures of Eisenhorn the Inquisitor and his retinue. It is fantasy through and through but fun and engaging through 3 stories.

items.title: Expert Python Programming
items.description: A book about advanced Python concepts. Nice to learn about more advanced Python concepts.

items.title: Extreme Ownership
items.description: Leif and Jocko go through their combat experiences in combat and the lessons in leadership that they have learned from them. They break down concepts, explain why they are important for the SEALS, and highlight them in the business context as well.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/Four Thousand Weeks Time Management for Mortals
items.title: Four Thousand Weeks Time Management for Mortals
items.description: This book takes all the productivity and self-help books and asks if we should take a step back and not be captives of our ambitions. This book is for those who try too hard to be 10X'ers and feel demotivated by their lack of results.
items.permalink: /docs/Books/Book Reviews/Four Thousand Weeks Time Management for Mortals

items.title: Fundamentals of Data Engineering
items.description: This book covers the fundamentals of data engineering and how to solve problems. of data engineering without going to much into detail of the programming. It introduces concepts such as data warehouse and Kafka and data pipelines and ETL.

items.title: Hooked
items.description: Tags: #books #non-fiction #development #psychology #apps

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/How the World Really Works
items.title: How the World Really Works
items.description: This book is for the naturalist and realists that are concerned about the environment. It goes through the most critical things that drive our modern society, cement, steel, ammonia and plastic, and goes through what it takes to produce said elements. You don't get that enthusiastic about a zero-oil society by reading it.

items.title: I Moved Your Cheese
items.description: This book is a fairy tale about mice and labyrinths. The characters of Max, Big, and Zed are musing on the fact that the mice are all in the maze and looking for cheese when there is no one asking why the cheese is always being moved around.

items.title: Imagined Communities
items.description: It is a kinda of half Marxist, half academic book about how language primarily shaped nation-states and how written language is the primary factor of nationalism. Imagined comities, aka the nation as a concept, are shaped by languages.

items.title: Kvitekrist
items.description: This book is about the life of Olav Haraldson, also known as Olav the Holy. This book offers a glimpse into how the Viking Age was. Mostly, it shows the strife and warfare that shaped history and how the impressions of the writers shape the historical narrative.

items.title: Learn Google Flutter Fast
items.description: This book is basically an introduction guide to google flutter and how to best start working with it. It goes through dart, flutter widgets, and state management, as well as other things. It gives example code as well as images of the apps created by the code.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/Letters to a Young Contrarian
items.title: Letters to a Young Contrarian
items.description: This book is about being right, not being in the crowd etc. It is advice on how to stay true to the principles. The letters are thoughtful and engaging.

items.title: Literature
items.description: This section is about the fine arts of literature and how I relate to them. I will use this section mostly as a way for me to relate to the great works.

items.title: Machine Learning Design Patterns
items.description: This book is about machine learning design patterns and discussions around those—concepts in machine learning for this. And therefore, it is a good reminder of the concepts and core tenants of machine learning.

items.title: Made to Stick
items.description: This book describes the underlying reasons why an idea sticks. It goes through the concreteness, unexpectedness, and credibility of an idea and how it affects how well an idea sticks. It goes through interesting cases and highlights reasons why these ideas have become ingrained in our collective minds.

items.title: Models
items.description: This book is about dating for men. But it is an honest book, that says that you should start with yourself and become a person people likes and you are comfortable with. Real men are vulnerable and in charge of their feelings.

items.title: On Palestine
items.description: This book is a critique of the horrendous way Israel has treated the Palestinians. It delves into all the classical arguments on the situations and dispels them. Their main argument is that Palestinians have as much of a right to their land as the Israelis.

items.title: Peopleware
items.description: This book addresses the elephant in the software room, that people, not tech, are the obstacle. Tech is just there to be applied; solving the problem requires a lot of people and knowledge to go the right way. It also addresses how to solve this problem for humans.

items.title: Personal MBA
items.description: A book with small but interesting stories and lessons. It is meant to concretize a master in business and administration into a single magnum opus. Its lessons are short but interesting.

items.title: Practical MLOps
items.description: This book is a no-nonsense book about practical MLOps and how you should approach it to solve business problems. The book takes an even more hardline approach to automation and focuses on the concept of Kaizen ML, where continuous improvement and striving to make the feedback loop even shorter and the process more and more seamless.

items.title: Practical Recommendation Systems
items.description: This book is an easy and good introduction to recommendation systems. It is meant to introduce the concept of recommendation systems and, from there, give concepts and methods on how to make them. This book is about usage rather than the theoretical background.

items.title: Pricing and Revenue Optimization
items.description: It is a book about price optimization as well as revenue management. It consists of multiple ways to do price optimization and deals with techniques from the industry.

items.title: Python Tricks
items.description: This book is just a lot of neet tricks to use in python.  It contains knowledge about structures in python, wrappers to use, and a lot of lot more. Nice for a developer with some python knowledge.

items.title: Red Country
items.description: It is a fantasy book that takes inspiration from the Wild West area, with impulses from a lot of different settings from previous books. Mostly a story about traveling and challenges, as well as a few twists and turns. Mostly a book that is easy to read.

items.title: Slaughterhouse Five
items.description: The book is about war, and imprisonment. It is written in an absurd matter which hides the traumas the person experience. It is an antiwar novel that is written as a comedy.

items.title: Soul in the Game
items.description: What is a meaningful life? Vitali takes on his journey filled with wisdom and experiences and tells beautiful stories that resonate. Topics such as life, wisdom, writing, and classical music are taken up with humor, emotion, and clarity.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/Spark The Revolutionary New Science of Exercise and the Brain
items.title: Spark The Revolutionary New Science of Exercise and the Brain
items.description: Spark is basically about how exercise is good for your brain as well as your body. Most of the book tells in allegories how exercise helps people become more focused and that by stopping exercising we are losing out on important functions for the brain as well as the body.
items.permalink: /docs/Books/Book Reviews/Spark The Revolutionary New Science of Exercise and the Brain

items.title: Stoner
items.description: Stoner portrays the life of William Stoner, from a young man and student to a professor in Literature. The book portrays the small things and trivial conflicts and relationships in life.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/Take Control of Automating Your Mac
items.title: Take Control of Automating Your Mac
items.description: This book is about cool and fast ways you can automate your Mac experience. It goes over the most important things you can automate, with a strong focus on Mac apps. It goes deeper into automation such as Keyboard Maestro
items.permalink: /docs/Books/Book Reviews/Take Control of Automating Your Mac

items.title: The blade Itself
items.description: This is the introductory. book in the first law series/world. It is the begining of the adventure of the main heroes of the first law triology. Most of it pertains to mundane tasks and world building.

items.title: The Blind Watchmaker
items.description: This book goes deep on evolution and explains how evolution is not random but rather an unconciusly driven thing that shapes the creatues. Dawkins eloquently dismisses arguments that darwinian evolution is random and that complexity cannot arrive by small steps and explains how it happes.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/The Box How the Shipping Container Made the World Smaller and the World Economy Bigger
items.title: The Box How the Shipping Container Made the World Smaller and the World Economy Bigger
items.description: This book contains the story of the container. It describes how it was first implemented, why it worked, and how the different actors behaved about the new innovation. The container shaped international trade more than anything else in the 20th century, and this is the story of how it came to be.
items.permalink: /docs/Books/Book Reviews/The Box How the Shipping Container Made the World Smaller and the World Economy Bigger

items.title: The Brothers Karamazov
items.description: It is a book that involves morality, love, and spirituality. It is a crime story with the morals of the characters being put on trial.

items.title: The Capitalist Manifesto
items.description: This book is a homage to the progress that capitalism has brought. It is an interesting comparison to the doom and gloom books. It is a book about the fantastic increase in wealth and prosperity that capitalism has brought.

items.title: The Creativity Code
items.description: This book is about how creativity is entering a new age where AI and machine learning enhances and sometimes surpass human creativity. It is about what creativity is at its core. And it is about how

items.title: The First World War
items.description: This book is about the history of the great world war. It covers the major strategic themes and goes in-depth on the conflicts outside of the Western front. It is a book that focuses on the war and only the war.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/The Man from the Future The Visionary Life of John von Neumann
items.title: The Man from the Future The Visionary Life of John von Neumann
items.description: This book is about the fascinating life of John von Neumann. It describes the work and the ramifications of the work he ventured on. Things like game theory, the biology of cell automata, economics, physics, mathematics, and computer science are all fields either founded or drastically influenced by the work of John von Neumann.
items.permalink: /docs/Books/Book Reviews/The Man from the Future The Visionary Life of John von Neumann

items.title: The Quants
items.description: This is a history book of people who revolutionized finance with math, game theory, and computers to model how the market work. However, the real world is not a model, and quants are also humans, as the financial crisis showed.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
items.title: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
items.description: This book examines what constitutes a "scientific revolution". The book goes into detail, with some specific examples covering Copernicus's heliocentric theory of astronomy, Lavoiser´s gas theory and Røntgen´s x-ray theory.  It covers what the background for each was and tries to find some common criteria for a scientific revolution.

items.title: The Triumph of Seeds
items.description: This book is about seeds from trees. How did they evolve? How did they flourish? What causes them to be like they are?

items.title: The Wim Hof Method
items.description: Breathing is apparently all you need. It can cure anxiety, hangovers, MS, and much more. Also, Ice baths are good as well and the core temperature can be manipulated.

items.title: The Wisdom of Crowds
items.description: Last book (for now) in the first law series. It is a good and interesting fantasy book in that it emulates the French Revolution. I quite liked it and how it portrays a turbulent age where power dictates the fate of life.

items.title: Thinking in Systems
items.description: This book is about understanding and conveying how the system works and how you can use systems thinking to understand the world differently. Systems have mechanisms that govern their behavior, and system thinking allows you to model how the system behaves when manipulating it.

items.title: Why Orwell Matters
items.description: Hitchens calmly and effectively demolishes the right, the left, and all others who have taken Orwell's name in vain. He delves into the absurd scenarios in 1984 and Animal Farm and highlights the same exact scenarios from real-life scenarios.  Imperialism, Fascism, and Communism, the great calamities of the 19th century, are shown through the lens of Orwell, and also how he always lands on the right side of history.

items.id: Books/Book Reviews/Why we get fat and what to do about it
items.title: Why we get fat and what to do about it
items.description: How I Discovered It
items.permalink: /docs/Books/Book Reviews/Why we get fat and what to do about it

items.title: Word by Word
items.description: It's a book about dictionaries.  It contains how dictionaries are made (very nerdy) and how the history of words has been shaped by a multitude of factors. Also, how silent it is at dictionary workshops.

items.title: Your Brain at Work
items.description: This book is about how you can understand and work on your performance by understanding how the brain works. The book goes through different scenarios and explains why the persons in the scenario do what they do and what they can do to achieve better results.  The book contains helpful hints about how to "hack" your brain to achieve better results and improve your life.
